alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Clarke; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Jackson; Madison; North Fulton; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:32AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Oconee, Barrow, northwestern DeKalb, Gwinnett, Clarke, northern Walton, southeastern Jackson, northeastern Fulton, northwestern Oglethorpe and southwestern Madison Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 932 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Roswell to Dacula to Hull, and moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Lawrenceville, Winder, Monroe, Watkinsville, Lexington, Athens, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Dunwoody, Duluth, Snellville, Suwanee, Lilburn, Loganville, Chamblee, Norcross and Doraville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Barrow; Clarke; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Jackson; Madison; North Fulton; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Walton
